text: Fred Ho (; born Fred Wei-han Houn; August 10, 1957 - April 12, 2014) was an American jazz baritone saxophonist, composer, bandleader, playwright, writer, and social activist. He was known for his place in the African-American and Asian-American music movement. He was born in Palo Alto, California. Ho died of colorectal cancer at his home in Brooklyn, New York City. He was 56. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1957 births Category:2014 deaths Category:American activists Category:American composers Category:American jazz musicians Category:American playwrights Category:American saxophonists Category:Bandleaders Category:Cancer deaths in New York City Category:Deaths from colorectal cancer Category:People from Palo Alto, California Category:Writers from California
title: Fred Ho
